Calculate and assign flags based on infection history

cg_annotate_episodes_count.Rd

This counts the total number of infections for each individual at the end of the study (or at that data freeze), and makes it available as a fresh column. this function should be run after cg_annotate_episodes_find(). For the cumulative number of infections use cg_annotate_episodes_find() only.

Usage

cg_annotate_episodes_count(
  x,
  episode_number = episode_number,
  count_col = count_col
)

Arguments

x

a chronogram

episode_number

a character vector to use to label the ID column. Default is "episode_number".

count_col

column with infection count

Value

A subsetted chronogram

See also

cg_annotate_episodes_find()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
cg <- cg_annotate_episodes_count(cg)
} # }
